Home.title: Join the FTX Customer Ad-Hoc Committee (CAHC) and Vote: NO
Home.latest_news_content: Mar 6: FTX Debtors request 4 month delay, pay US Gov with customer assets
Home.description: With over 1000+ former FTX customers holding 9-figures in claims we have formed the largest voting block in the FTX bankruptcy cases.
Home.legal_counsel: Our legal counsel McCarter & English, LLP have filed customer property litigation: docket 6863
Home.join_us: Join us in voting NO on any plan that fails to addresses serious issues impacting recovery of customer property.
Home.read_more: Read our <bylaws>bylaws</bylaws> and <charter>charter</charter> to learn more.

FightingFor.we_vote_no: We vote 'no' on any plan unless the following issues are addressed
FightingFor.debtors_filed_plan: The debtors have filed a half-baked and value-destructive plan. We aim to fix it by litigating our property rights and negotiating for common sense solutions like those below.
FightingFor.priority_for_customers_desc: If the current plan stands, upside goes to non-customers even from proceeds that were 100% traced to customer wallets, like Anthropic.
FightingFor.theft_of_property_damages_desc: Customers should recover today's valuation of their crypto assets due to theft of property.
FightingFor.no_withholding_tax_desc: Since the large majority of customers are non-US we will be subject to a 30% withholding tax which we will have to claim back from the IRS, an issue that the debtors have completely ignored due to their US focus.
FightingFor.digital_distributions_desc: The debtors want to distribute recoveries via 'cash' which is lawyer-speak for checks in the mail. This is a huge and costly administrative burden that will reduce and delay recoveries.

Dashboard.title: Welcome to the FTX Customer Ad-Hoc Voting Blo1ck
Dashboard.subtitle: We have now formed the largest voting block with hundreds of members and 9-figures in claims.
Dashboard.now_what_text: Join the <telegram>Telegram</telegram> group. Look out for emails from <white>updates@ftxvote.com</white> for further instructions.
Dashboard.about_us_text:
Thus far the FTX Debtors have proposed a value destructive plan.

Since the Unsecured Creditors Committee has a fiduciary duty to all unsecured creditors including Alameda creditors, they are unable to fight on behalf of only FTX customers. Nor is the Ad Hoc Committee counseled by Eversheds an option, as they already agreed to settle their litigation and are now bound to support the debtors.

The estate is due to recover well over 100% petition date value and instead of accruing the surplus back to customers, the debtors plan to use our assets to pay non-customers and US government regulators instead.

The judge requires us to formally organize in order for our point of view to be considered in court.

ThisIsMyClaim.text: Register this claim to get started

Find.title: Find a claim
Find.subtitle: For us to represent your voice in court, you must register your claim with us. If your claim shows correctly in <MyClaims>My Claims</MyClaims> then you don't need to do anything.

SearchForm.description: Specify roughly how many tokens you had to identify your claim.

RecoveryAnalysis.title: Recovery Analysis
RecoveryAnalysis.subtitle: The estate holds far more assets than the customer property valued at petition date prices which will lead to a >$1 plan.

Register.notification: Selected {count, plural, one {# claim} other {# claims}}

SignUpWithClaims.confirmOwnershipText: Do you confirm, under penalty of perjury, that you are the owner of {count, plural, one {this claim?} other {these claims?}}
SignUpWithClaims.agreementText: By confirming you agree to the CAHC defending your property rights, to publish your name in a declaration to the court, to receive emails and to abide by our <bylaws>bylaws</bylaws>.
SignUpWithClaims.disagreementWarning: If you DO NOT confirm, the court will assume customers agree with the debtors' proposed petition value recoveries.
SignUpWithClaims.checkEmailMessage: Check your email for next steps.
